text: Thanks dude, this helped. Hopefully HubSpot will allow for a more advanced menu setup in future. I’m going to try the nth-child first in terms of relative positions as I have two drop downs and the client is not likely to touch anything on this site.
it might just be a span tag with inline css
yea, it looks like its wrapped in `<code>` tag, but these are stripped when you try to enter them in

I believe that style this is added by in-app CSS looking for a `<code></code>`wrapper, but we strip user-entered HTML in these help text fields so it’s not possible to recreate. Curious to hear more about the use case <@UDU6KEBFB>, it’s not something we’ve necessarily considered
I think it's just to be used for better formatting of help labels and to call them out better
it easier to show examples similar to how HS does it for separating code vs text in a help
I think it would be awesome to have a toggle for the description that would let you pop the help text under the label instead of being in a tooltip
when building CM's for customers, sometimes a little direction is needed
I created a class field with a text field and I'd like to tip the users on which class may be used in that field
Would have been nice to replicate what HS does but it is not a must
Thanks for the feedback, guys. I’ll make sure other members of the team hear this, too.
